intro: Primula coelata, commonly known as the ghost primrose, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of East Asia. It is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink, often with a contrasting throat. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with lanceolate leaves that are often hairy. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or forested habitats. The flowers bloom in early spring, adding a delicate touch to its natural surroundings.
